intro: Lippia aristata, commonly known as Mexican mint marigold, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, narrow leaves and small, yellowish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is often used in traditional medicine and as a culinary herb due to its distinctive mint-like scent. Lippia aristata is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract beneficial insects.
